stk.molecular.topologies.rotaxane module¶

Defines rotaxane topologies.

class stk.molecular.topologies.rotaxane.NRotaxane(repeating_unit, orientation, n)¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.base.Topology

Represents the topology of [n]rotaxanes.

This class assumes one axle with (n-1) macrocycles threaded on it. The macrocycles are spaced evenly along the thread in repeating patterns analogous to non-bonded monomers in Linear. The orientation of the macrocycle defines the threading direction, thus giving access to different mechanical stereoisomers. The axle is automatically found in the list of MacroMolecule.building_blocks so only the order of the macrocycles in the list is important for construction.

repeating_unit¶

A string showing the repeating unit of the macrocycles within Rotaxane. For example, "AB" or "ABB", would implied two or three macrocycles threaded, respectively. The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.

Type:str
orientation¶

For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 and 1 (both inclusive) must be given in a list. It indicates the probability that each macrocycle will have its orientation along the axle flipped. If 0 then the macrocycle is guaranteed be aligned with the axle. If 1 it is guaranteed to be aligned against the axle. This allows the user to create stereoisomers.

Type:tuple of float
n¶

The number of repeating units in the rotaxane.

Type:int
__init__(repeating_unit, orientation, n)¶

Initialize a NRotaxane instance.

Parameters:
  • repeating_unit (str) – A string showing the repeating unit of the macrocycles within Rotaxane. For example, "AB" or "ABB", would implied two or three macrocycles threaded, respectively. The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.
  • orientation (tuple of float) – For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (inclusive) must be given. The values give the probability that each macrocycle is threaded onto the axle in the opposite directions. If 0 then the macrocycle is guaranteed be aligned with the axle. If 1 it is guaranteed to be aligned against the axle. This allows the user to create stereoisomers.
  • n (int) – The number of macrocyclerepeating units which are used to make rotaxane. Constructs [n*len(repeat_unit)+1]rotaxane.
_minmax_x(axle, exclude_ids=None)¶

Calculate the maximum and minimum x coordinate along the axle.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being assembled.
  • axle (StructUnit) – The axle of the rotaxane.
Returns:

  • float – The minium x coordinate along the axle.
  • float – The minium x coordinate along the axle.
bonded_fgs(macro_mol)¶

Yield functional groups to react.

Parameters:macro_mol (Rotaxane) – The polymer being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – Holds the ids of the functional groups set to react.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
cleanup(macro_mol)¶

Performs final clean up actions on an assembled molecule.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
place_mols(macro_mol)¶

Distribute the macrocycles evenly along the axis.

The axle is positioned along the x axis and the macrocycles are distributed evenly and rotates to that the vectors normal to their planes lie along the the axle.

Parameters:macro_mol (Rotaxane) – The rotaxane being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
prepare(macro_mol)¶

Performs ops between placing and reacting building blocks.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
